sentence.Network_en: Police corruption is not just a few rotten apples.

sentence.Network_en: Molly razzed me about my rotten sense of direction.
sentence.Network_cn: 莫利笑话我糟糕的方向感。

sentence.Network_en: They made the treacherous journey across stormy seas in rotten boats.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们乘着破旧的小船穿越风大浪急的海面，完成了这次危险之旅。

means.word_mean: 腐朽的,不道德的,堕落的,无耻的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse rotinn

entry.def: If food, wood, or another substance is rotten, it has decayed and can no longer be used.

example.ex: The smell outside this building is overwhelming — like rotten eggs...
example.tran: 这栋大楼外面的气味让人无法忍受——就像臭鸡蛋的味道。

example.ex: The front bay window is rotten.

entry.tran: (事物)非常糟糕的，很差劲的，极其拙劣的
entry.def: If you describe something as rotten, you think it is very unpleasant or of very poor quality.

example.ex: I personally think it's a rotten idea...
example.tran: 我个人觉得这个主意非常糟糕。

example.ex: I had a pretty rotten day yesterday...

entry.tran: (人)极讨厌的，坏透了的，非常不友善的
entry.def: If you describe someone as rotten, you are insulting them or criticizing them because you think that they are very unpleasant or unkind.

example.ex: You rotten swine! How dare you?...
example.tran: 你这个讨厌鬼！你竟敢这样？

example.ex: That's a rotten thing to say!
example.tran: 说这样的话真是太刻薄了！

entry.tran: 感到不适的;感到抱歉的;难受的
entry.def: If you feel rotten, you feel bad, either because you are ill or because you are sorry about something.

example.ex: I had glandular fever and spent that year feeling rotten...
example.tran: 我得了腺热，那一整年都不舒服。

example.ex: Suddenly, Sarah felt rotten about the whole thing.
example.tran: 突然，萨拉对整件事情感到内疚。

entry.tran: (强调不喜欢、愤怒、烦恼)令人讨厌的
entry.def: You use rotten to emphasize your dislike for something or your anger or annoyance about it.

example.tran: 她是一个讨厌的胆小鬼。

means.word_mean: 2. having rotted or disintegrated; usually implies foulness;
3. damaged by decay; hence unsound and useless;

sentences.en: The smell of the rotten meat was enough!
sentences.cn: 这腐臭的肉闻一下就够人受的了！

sentences.en: The man's morals are rotten to the core.

jushi.english: The boys ran to the river to go swimming and Dick cried,“the last one is a rotten egg.”
jushi.chinese: 男孩们跑到河里去游泳,狄克喊道：“最后到的是坏蛋。”

jushi.english: The smell of the rotten meat was enough!
jushi.chinese: 这腐臭的肉闻一下就够人受的了!
